com.baypackets.ase.sbb
Class MsPlaySpec

java.lang.Object
  com.baypackets.ase.sbb.MsPlaySpec
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class MsPlaySpec
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

The MsPlaySpec class defines the specification for a media server Play operation. This class provides methods for defining audio clips and variable announcements to be played. It also defines methods for specifying the language for playing the announcement set and variable announcements. This class also defines the methods for specifying the number of iterations to repeat the play list and the time interval between each of the repetitions.

See Also:

Constructor Detail

MsPlaySpec

public MsPlaySpec()
Method Detail

getInterval

public int getInterval()
Returns time interval or delay in milliseconds between each iteration of this specification.

Returns:
Interval in milliseconds.

setInterval

public void setInterval(int interval)
Sets the time interval or delay in milliseconds between each iteration of this specification.

The Interval accepts a Non-Negative integer value as the valid input. In case of the specified value is not within the range as specified by the Media Server, it will be ignored and the media server default (if any) will be used.

See the media server documentation for the acceptable range of values for this attribute.

Parameters:
interval - Interval in milliseconds
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the value entered is a negative integer.

getIterations

public int getIterations()
Returns the number of iterations for this play specification.

Returns:
Number of iterations.

setIterations

public void setIterations(int iterations)
Sets the number of times this whole specification is to be played.

In case of the specified value is not within the range as specified by the Media Server, it will be ignored and the media server default (if any) will be used.

See the media server documentation for the acceptable range of values for this attribute.

Parameters:
iterations - Number of times this whole specification is to be played.

getLanguage

public java.lang.String getLanguage()
Returns the language used for playing the announcement sets and the variable announcements.

Returns:
Language to play the announcement sets or variable announcements.

setLanguage

public void setLanguage(java.lang.String language)
Sets the language for playing the announcement sets and variable announcements.

In case of the specified value is not within the range as specified by the Media Server, it will be ignored and the media server default (if any) will be used.

See the media server documentation for the acceptable range of values for this attribute.

Parameters:
language - for playing the announcement sets and variable announcements.

isBarge

public boolean isBarge()
Returns TRUE if the DTMF digit collection should interrupt playing of these audio clips.

setBarge

public void setBarge(boolean barge)
A value of TRUE specifies the media server to interrupt the audio clips if the digit collection starts while the audio is playing.

isClearDigitBuffer

public boolean isClearDigitBuffer()
Returns whether the media server would clear the digit buffer before start playing this specification.

setClearDigitBuffer

public void setClearDigitBuffer(boolean clearDigitBuffer)
Sets the flag to indicate whether or not clear the digit buffer before start playing these audio clips.

getPlayList

public java.util.Iterator getPlayList()
Returns the iterator for the play list.

The play list contains announcement URIs, announcement set IDs, or variable announcements in the order in which they are added to the Play Operation specification object.

Returns:
the iterator for the play list.

addAnnouncementURI

public void addAnnouncementURI(java.net.URI uri)
Adds this URI to the end of the play list. This is the URI specifying the location of the audio clip to be played.

Parameters:
uri - URI to be added to the play list.

addAnnouncementSet

public void addAnnouncementSet(java.lang.String annSet)
Adds this announcement set name to the play list. This playlist should be already provisioned in the media server using the Media Server specific provisioning methods.

Parameters:
annSet -

addVariableAnnouncement

public void addVariableAnnouncement(MsVarAnnouncement var)
Adds this variable announcement to the end of the current play list.

Parameters:
var - Variable announcement to be added to the play list.

clearPlayList

public void clearPlayList()
This method clears the contents of the play list.
